result.execSummary:
The defendant Denis Reyes Santos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 45 days credit. TIME SERVED

Court will apply credit time in the amount of $100 to the Cost, and waives the remaining balance of $143.  
Court will apply credit time in the amount of $200 to the DNA Surcharge.
COSTS PAID IN FULL

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:40 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Denis Reyes Santos.
Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody. 
Interpreter, Sarah St. John sworn to interpret.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1, 2, and 4 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 3.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
45-DAYS JAIL
45-DAYS CREDIT TIME
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $243.00 (Apply credit time of $100.00) *Court will WAIVE the balance of $143.00*
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (Apply credit time to pay in full)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Defendant has an additional 4 days credit (Court converts 1 day to $75.00) = $300.00*
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Pablo Galaviz
Jury trial - 12 person on January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised that parties discussed scheduling off the record to set a Jury Trial in 22CF12117 and 22CM1271 will tag along.  Clerk swears in interpreter Sally Nichols, who appeared by Zoom.  Defense counsel advised that defendant did not understand the interpretation.  Discussion made regarding interpreter and languages spoken.  Atty. Galaviz gave clarification to the Court and defendant regarding bail motion. Court advised State if they wish to file a Motion for Joinder, it must be filed by 11/11/22.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:24 AM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Denis Reyes Santos.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter and sworn in. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Carly Rawson, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Campbell.
Cross examination by attorney Galaviz.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Galaviz.
Filed by Atty. Pablo Galaviz
Attorney Pablo Galaviz

Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.  Attorney Gutierrez states they just found out there is a conflict and their office will need to appoint out for counsel.  Attorney Gutierrez states he has spone to the defendant who is willing to waive the time limits for the hearing.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court adjourns for a preliminary hearing date and an additional status of counsel date the day prior.  SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE STATUS OF COUNSEL DATE AND PRELIMINARY HEARING DATE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:29 PM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brenda Bartholomew appeared as interpreter.  Attorney Herbers states Attorney Luis Gutierrez has been appointed and they will have the paperwork finalized by this afternoon.  Attorney Herbers states attorney Gutierrez has requested to leave the preliminary hearing date on for tomorrow.  Preliminary hearing remains set for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Bail remains as fixed.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B/Frame Park listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives

01:55 PM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter by zoom.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR STATUS OF COUNSEL DATE AND PRELIMINARY HEARING DATE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
